content: 1. What does product-feature similarity refer to in brand extensions?

answers.text: a) Using the same advertising slogan
b) Shared product features and functions
c) Geographic proximity of production sites
d) Same pricing structure

content: 2. Which effect describes the influence of a brand extension on the parent brand?

answers.text: a) Fit effect
b) Reciprocal spillover effect
c) Licensing effect
d) Image distortion

content: 3. What is an advantage of ingredient branding?

answers.text: a) Low brand awareness
b) Quality signaling
c) No control over the product
d) Increased cannibalization risk

content: 4. What is a typical feature of horizontal brand extensions?

answers.text: a) Higher quality level than the original product
b) Same quality level as the main brand
c) Focus on functional benefits
d) Expansion into new countries

content: 5. What does the ownership effect in vertical extensions describe according to Kirmani et al. (1999)?

answers.text: a) Brand owners generally reject extensions
b) Owners react more positively to extensions than non-owners
c) The effect only occurs for price brands
d) The effect only applies to horizontal extensions

content: 6. What is a risk of brand alliances according to Keller & Swaminathan (2020)?

answers.text: a) Decreased brand awareness
b) Negative spillover effects
c) Higher production costs
d) Slower market entry
a) Two brands at the same value chain level
b) Combination of brands at different value chain levels
c) Brand merger with a shared name
d) Exchange of logos in product packaging

content: 8. When is a family branding strategy typically used?

answers.text: a) For products with highly differentiated target groups
b) For a product group with a consistent brand identity
c) Only for B2B brands
d) When the company does not want to disclose its name

content: 9. What is an advantage of the single branding strategy?

answers.text: a) Low cost of brand development
b) Ability to address target groups precisely
c) Maximum visibility of the company
d) Synergies through joint advertising campaigns

content: 10. Which strategy uses the same brand name for all products?

answers.text: a) Single branding
b) Corporate branding
c) Family branding
d) Ingredient branding

content: 11. Which statement about co-branding is correct?

answers.text: a) The brands operate at different value chain levels
b) It is a horizontal brand alliance
c) One brand is absorbed
d) Only suitable for new products

content: 12. According to Park et al. (1996), what most strongly influences the perception of an alliance product?

answers.text: a) Alphabetical order of brand names
b) The brand mentioned first
c) Market shares of the brands
d) Color of the packaging

content: 13. What does the term brand architecture describe?

answers.text: a) The graphic design of a logo
b) The structure and roles of all brands in a company
c) The architecture of a flagship store
d) The relationship with influencers

content: 14. What is a typical trigger for brand repositioning?

answers.text: a) An internal CEO change
b) Technological or societal changes
c) Product shortages
d) Discontinuation of advertising

content: 15. What are the two main goals of long-term brand management?

answers.text: a) Building new brands and focusing on pricing policy
b) Stabilizing knowledge structures and adapting to environmental changes
c) Optimizing logistics and price analysis
d) Personalization and discount management
